title: 'InvalidGitRepositoryError' object has no attribute 'stderr'
body:
When it rains it pours
```
$> rm -rf ds; mkdir ds && cd ds && git init && touch file && mkdir -p d1/subds && git -C d1/subds init && datalad add -d . d1/subds; touch d1/subds/subfile && datalad add -r * 
Initialized empty Git repository in /tmp/ds/.git/
Initialized empty Git repository in /tmp/ds/d1/subds/.git/
[ERROR  ] 'InvalidGitRepositoryError' object has no attribute 'stderr' [add.py:__call__:377] (AttributeError) 
add(ok): /tmp/ds/d1/subds/subfile (file)
add(ok): /tmp/ds/d1/subds (dataset)
add(ok): /tmp/ds/d1/subds/subfile (file)

add(ok): /tmp/ds/d1 (directory)
save(ok): /tmp/ds/d1/subds (dataset)
save(ok): /tmp/ds (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 5)
  save (ok: 2)
```

```
(Pdb) l
372  	                # Register the repository in the repo tree as a submodule
```

I guess .stderr was expected of CommandError.  I will suggest a quick&dirty fix shortly
